Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Our Company

Congo Brands is at the epicenter of where consumer demand meets product development. Through brand partnerships with lead influencers, we are afforded an inside look at what consumers truly desire. Congo Brands is a health and wellness brand that sells supplements, fitness snacks, hydration drinks, energy drinks, and more through e-commerce and retail partnerships. Congo Brands houses some of the world's most noted brands including Alani Nu, Prime Hydration, and 3D Energy. Congo Brands is on pace to become one of the world's most noted consumer product companies, with revenue growth increasing exponentially year over year. Congo Brand's goal is to be the go-to ‘Better for You Brand' for everything from ready-to-drink beverages, snacks, supplements and more.


The Role

Do you live and breathe Power BI? We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Sales Insights team. You will be responsible for leveraging data to provide strategic insights that guide our business decisions across our brands. You will collect, analyze, and help visualize data to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and solve complex problems. This Senior Data Analyst will work closely with various teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights through interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.


Deliver accurate, consistent, and timely reports for internal stakeholders.
Develop and design interactive Power BI reports and dashboards to support business decision-making.
Collect, clean, maintain, analyze, and interpret complex data sets to inform business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build and automate dashboards from multiple data sources.
Pro-actively create and investigate hypotheses about brands, conversations or audiences that lead to new insights or projects.
Develop diverse data analysis methodologies and produce analytical reports during regular operations and peak periods, deeply analyze and identify business issues, opportunities, and breakthroughs, and collaborate on horizontal optimization.
Continuously improve analytical techniques and toolsets for more efficient problem-solving.
Create and maintain data models, DAX queries, and Power BI datasets.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Power BI reports and data connectivity.
Stay updated with the latest Power BI features, best practices, and industry trends.
Provide training and support to end-users on Power BI tools and functionalities.
Ensure data security and compliance with organizational policies and regulations.



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, related field or working experience.
PL-300 Certification an asset
Proven experience as a Power BI Analyst/Developer or in a similar role for at least 3 years.
Expert level proficiency in Power BI, including data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
Experience with SQL and data warehousing concepts.
Familiarity with data visualization best practices and principles.
Proven experience in optimizing the performance of Power BI reports and dashboards, including data model tuning, efficient DAX query writing, and ensuring optimal data load times.
Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Knowledge of other BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Qlik) is a plus.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure) is an advantage.
Proven experience consolidating and analyzing data sources to create insightful business intelligence.
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
Strong attention to detail, superior organizational and time management skills.
Ability to support team members and take direction from senior team members and management.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated sense of curiosity and ability to ask the right questions.
Growth mindset, a willingness to learn to improve and sharpen skillsets.



Benefits


Competitive Salary
Health/Vision/Dental Benefits
15 days of PTO + 8 paid holidays
6 weeks paid parental leave
401K plan with employer match
Monthly cell phone stipend
AND SO MUCH MORE!

  

Congo Brands, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

#PRIME

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Understand the entire data stack for the relevant business partner. Masan has companies with long histories and entrenched knowledge - the analyst must have the ability to deep dive, explore, and “own” knowledge of all things related to that company’s data
Using that data, create insights that leverage cutting edge analytical concepts and technology – these can be in the form of presentations, dashboards, recurring meetings, among other things
Present the key findings to senior leaders
In addition to providing descriptive analytics of what has occurred, the analyst is expected to provide forward-looking insights that can help with longer-term strategic planning
Create clear and usable documentation that can be leveraged by other analysts and non-technical members

QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, & REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree with major in Statistics, Economics, or equivalent degree that is technical in nature
Minimum one to two years experience in analytics
Should be very proficient in SQL and have experience querying large datasets (hundreds of millions of rows); BigQuery and Databricks experiences are preferred
Should have a solid grasp of an analytics language – Python or R
Familiar with using and creating dashboards (LookerStudio, PowerBI, Tableau, Superset, etc.)
Can communicate in Vietnamese at a professional level; English is preferred at professional level as well, but at least minimum working proficiency
Hard working, creative,open-minded, highly responsible, ability to work under pressure, independent

Title: Analista de Datos BI
Description:
¿Eres un apasionado de los datos y quieres iniciar tu carrera en el sector financiero?

Buscamos un Analista de Datos Junior en Power BI que desee contribuir a la transformación de la empresa mediante la interpretación y análisis de datos.




Analista de Datos BI.




😊 En este puesto podrás:

Desarrollar modelos de datos, ETL's, DWH, datamarts, ABT's y/o tablas de información para la estructura de datos.
Comunicar las solicitudes de información requerida por diversas áreas para determinación de acuerdos de entrega de datos.
Desarrollar y ejecutar procesos almacenados calendarizados para la obtención de datos que comparten con diversas áreas.
Operar herramientas de BI para la creación de reportes de información.
Diseñar reportes, indicadores y/o KPI´s de diversas de su dirección.




🔎 El perfil ideal cuenta con:

Licenciatura en Actuaría, matemáticas aplicadas, Ingeniería, Sistemas o afín.
SQL (intermedio).
Power BI (intermedio).
SAS (deseable).
Python (básico).




💰 Tus beneficios por ser parte de Profuturo:

Contratación directa.
Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores.
Seguro Dental, Seguro de Vida
Totalpass
Prestaciones superiores a la ley (fondo de ahorro, prima vacacional, 20 días de aguinaldo).
+5,000 materiales de capacitación.
Rutas de formación para tu desarrollo
Oportunidad de participar en voluntariados.
Torneos internos, actividades deportivas y celebraciones corporativas.
Beneficios y descuentos preferenciales.




📍 Tu nueva ubicación laboral:

Boulevard Adolfo López Mateos #2009, Col. Los Alpes, Del. Álvaro Obregón, CDMX.







🎉 Profuturo es una empresa comprometida con igualdad de oportunidades. Todas las personas recibirán consideración para el empleo sin distinción de raza, color, religión, sexo, discapacidad, edad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, origen nacional, condición de veterano o información genética. De igual manera, es política de Profuturo proporcionar ajustes razonables a las personas con discapacidad o con alguna necesidad específica, para garantizar el acceso y uso de los servicios, programas y actividades de trabajo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Duration: 12 Months

Location: San Jose, CA 95110

Pay Rate: $66.2 per hour on W2




Intelliswift Software Inc. conceptualizes, builds, and supports the world's most amazing technology products and solutions. Our team of rich experts from diverse backgrounds contributes to making Intelliswift one of the most reliable partners in IT and Talent solutions. We specialize in delivering world-class Digital Product Engineering, Data Management and Analytics, and Staffing Solutions services to Fortune companies, SMBs, ISVs, and fast-growing start-ups.




Job Description:

Drive analytics for Document Cloud to unlock growth and monetization opportunities and hypothesis tests (A/B testing's) through analyzing results and communicating insights and recommendations.
Partner with cross-functional/cross-regional team including growth managers, product manager, GTM, finance, and engineering's to understand monetization opportunities, product/customer behavior and features, and use insights generated to make recommendations to improve customer experience and drive monetization.
Be a specialist of stitching and calibrating sparse and noisy data across various data sources.
Support regular ad-hoc data and analysis needs to better understand customer behavior, end-to-end customer journey, and monetization path.
Define metrics/reporting frameworks and design and implement reporting dashboards and track Key Performance Indicators and provide useful insights.




Requirement:

Expertise in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and A/B test analytics.
Expertise in working with large data sets using SQL.
Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving ability.
Ability to synthesize large scale data sets to generate a clear story and impactful insights to senior/cross-functional stakeholders.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Ability to work with stakeholders across different time zone.
Hands-On coding experience with at least one programming language (Python/R).
Hands-on experience working with Cloud Platform e.g. Databricks. Ability to build and run data pipelines in Cloud.
Experience in developing sophisticated reports/dashboards using Tableau & Power BI.
Good attention to detail and ability to stitch and QA multiple data sources.
Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics experience is a plus.




Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Intelliswift celebrates a diverse and inclusive workforce. We offer equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants will be considered regardless of race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expressions, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected basis under the law.




Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact Intelliswift Human Resources Department




Other Employment Statements

Intelliswift participates in the E-Verify program.




Learn More

For information on Intelliswift Software, Inc., visit our website at www.intelliswift.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Ascendion

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.




Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life




We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

Build the coolest tech for world’s leading brands
Solve complex problems – and learn new skills
Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience




Experience a community of change makers!

Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.




About the Role:




Job Title: Data Analyst




Location: Onsite in Seattle, WA




Daily Responsibilities:

Extracts data from various databases; performs exploratory data analysis, cleanses, massages, and aggregates data
Apply basic statistical concepts and descriptive statistics to understand and describe relationships in data
Builds predictive models and complex descriptive analytics, such as clustering and market basket analysis
Participates in discussions with business partners to define business questions and to consult
Creates impactful visual representations of analytic insights and concise summaries of methodology geared to audience needs; presents selected portions to stakeholders
Provides analytic support (code documentation, data transformations, algorithms, etc.) to implement analytic insights and recommendations into business processes (e.g., automation of process to level up Lab analytics)
Contributes to analytic project proposals
Promotes and advocates for the value of analytics and data among peers
Provides knowledge share and mentorship to team in databases, tools, access, data prep techniques




Technology requirements:

MS Office tooling
Smart Sheets
Exposure and business-applicable experience in several data ETL (Teradata, Oracle, SQL, Python, Java, Ruby, Pig)
SQL and Python are priority, data bricks preferred
Experience with Azure, AWS Databricks preferred




Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $100,000-$110,000 annually. Factors which may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.




Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [5 personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertains to the City/ State] [10-15 days of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]




Want to change the world? Let us know.

Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

Title: Data Analyst - Cognos REQUIRED
Description:
Cognos Experience in REQUIRED




If you do not have Cognos, you will not be considered




No C2C

No Sponsorship




Come work for one of the best companies in the nation and this in 100% remote (there will be a preference candidates local to St. Louis, MO)!




Apply ASAP!




Data Analyst




DETAILED data warehouse and SQL knowledge required.

Data warehouse is very complicated and must have extensive experience.

Some understanding of data warehouse development with QA experience would be preferred.

Experience using Cognos extracts required.

Prefer local applicants, but we are open to remote for the right candidate.

This is a 100% work-from-home position

Equipment will be provided.




We are seeking a detail-oriented Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Quality/Data Analyst to ensure the quality and reliability of our student data warehouse systems. The ideal candidate will have a robust understanding of databases, ETL processes, and data validation techniques. This role involves performing data quality assessments, creating and executing test cases, and collaborating with the development team to optimize data integrity and performance.




Perform Quality Assurance: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases designed to detect issues in data warehousing systems.
ETL Testing: Validate ETL processes, ensuring that data is correctly extracted, transformed, and loaded into the data warehouse.
Report, dashboard and semantic layer testing in tools like Cognos and Tableau.
Data Validation: Conduct data quality checks to verify accuracy, consistency, and completeness of data.
Automation: Develop and maintain automated testing scripts for data validation and ETL processes.
Collaborate: Work closely with Data Engineers, Developers, Business Analysts, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and resolve any data quality issues.
Defect Tracking: Log, track, and report defects and work with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of test plans, test cases, and testing procedures.
Compliance: Ensure data warehouse processes comply with departmental standards.




Skills:

SQL and Data Warehouse coding experience a plus.
Above average Microsoft Word/Excel skills and an understanding of XML.
Understanding of star schema and data warehouse structures like tables, indexes, facts, dimensions and bridge tables.
Report Writing experience in Cognos is preferred.
Knowledge of Tableau/PowerBI is a plus but not required.
Evaluating and analyzing data related to business requirements.
Ability to extract data from a data warehouse and use comparative analysis to confirm data quality.
Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, plus 2 years relevant technology experience or equivalent combination of education & experience.
5 years relevant technology experience

This role involves performing data quality assessments, creating and executing test cases, and collaborating with the development team to optimize data integrity and performance.


  • Perform Quality Assurance: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases designed to detect issues in data warehousing systems.
  • ETL Testing: Validate ETL processes, ensuring that data is correctly extracted, transformed, and loaded into the data warehouse.
  • Report, dashboard and semantic layer testing in tools like Cognos and Tableau.
  • Data Validation: Conduct data quality checks to verify accuracy, consistency, and completeness of data.
  • Automation: Develop and maintain automated testing scripts for data validation and ETL processes.
  • Collaborate: Work closely with Data Engineers, Developers, Business Analysts, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and resolve any data quality issues.
  • Defect Tracking: Log, track, and report defects and work with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of test plans, test cases, and testing procedures.
  • Compliance: Ensure data warehouse processes comply with departmental standards.


Skills:

  • SQL and Data Warehouse coding experience a plus.
  • Above average Microsoft Word/Excel skills and an understanding of XML.
  • Understanding of star schema and data warehouse structures like tables, indexes, facts, dimensions and bridge tables.
  • Report Writing experience in Cognos is preferred.
  • Knowledge of Tableau/PowerBI is a plus but not required.
  • Evaluating and analyzing data related to business requirements.
  • Ability to extract data from a data warehouse and use comparative analysis to confirm data quality.
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, plus 2 years relevant technology experience or equivalent combination of education & experience.
  • 5 years relevant technology experience

Title: Data Analyst with Data Visualization (Local to VA)- W2
Description:
Overview

The Data Analyst with Data Visualization role is pivotal in transforming data into actionable insights within our organization. This position combines analytical prowess with the ability to represent complex data visually, enhancing decision-making processes. The Data Analyst will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, analyze data trends, and create compelling visualizations that communicate findings effectively to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a deep understanding of data and reporting tools, and a genuine passion for uncovering insights that drive business growth. Being based in Virginia, the analyst will contribute to local projects and collaborate with regional teams, making this role integral to our data strategy and overall success. Innovation, accuracy, and efficiency are the cornerstones of this position, and the individual will serve as a key resource in fostering a data-driven culture within the organization.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources.
Create informative and visually appealing dashboards and reports.
Develop and implement data visualization strategies.
Work with stakeholders to identify business requirements and objectives.
Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis.
Monitor and improve data quality across platforms.
Utilize SQL to query and extract data from databases.
Aggregate and summarize data to facilitate informed decision-making.
Perform statistical analyses to identify trends and patterns.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to improve data collection processes.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analytics.
Train and support staff in data use and interpretation.
Assist in the development of business cases based on data insights.
Present findings to executive management and other stakeholders.
Document processes and methodologies for data analysis.


Required Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Strong proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Advanced Excel skills, including VBA and pivot tables.
Experience with SQL and relational database management systems.
Basic knowledge of programming languages (Python or R is a plus).
Strong understanding of statistical methods and data modeling.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Proven problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy.
Experience in developing dashboards for executive reporting.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Familiarity with data governance and data quality frameworks.
Willingness to participate in continuous learning and development.
Local to Virginia or willingness to relocate.


Skills: excel,data storytelling,data visualization,statistical methods,critical thinking,sql,tableau,data modeling,data analysis,data quality frameworks,power bi,sql proficiency,programming languages (python or r),data governance,reporting tools

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Ascendion:

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.




Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life:

We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

Build the coolest tech for the world’s leading brands
Solve complex problems - and learn new skills
Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience




Experience a community of change-makers!




Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.




About the Role: 100% Remote Role - Business Data Analyst




Job Title: Business Data Analyst




Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst responsible for application domain analysis of the projects under the control or influenced by the Commerce, Enterprise and Engineering Group. Helps to coordinate tasks for developers by updating tickets as to status, advice, testing progress, and urgency. Assist in training and meet with business experts to analyze requirements for support and development of upgrades, new releases, and rollout of programs or systems. Helps in identifying and documenting system enhancements to control costs, increase revenue, time savings, or standardization of policies as well as define test criteria, preparation and compilation of test cases, analysis of results, and validation of Systems in support of project and company objectives. Responsible for maintaining deadlines, communicating with leadership and vendors, as well as delivery of projects on time and on budget.




Responsibilities

Run data analysis across various business areas.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define business needs and data requirements.
Interpret data trends and provide strategic recommendations to senior management.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and company policies.
Analyze expected data inputs and outputs from AI models, ensuring accurate insights.




Minimum Qualifications:

5-7 years of experience as a Business Data Analyst across various business areas.
Proficient in Power BI, SQL, DAX, Power Query. Data modeling and proficiency in Python/Pandas is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics or Statistics, or a related field.
Proven ability to analyze AI model data and produce actionable insights.
Full professional proficiency in English, including native-level fluency.




Location: 100% Remote




Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $80000/year - $100000/year USD. Factors that may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.




Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [5 personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertain to the City/ State] [10-15 days of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]




Want to change the world? Let us know.




Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Data Analyst

Location: South Portland, ME

Reports To: Chief Operating Officer




Position Summary: The Data Analyst will utilize a generalist data analytics skillset to significantly impact S&W’s internal business reporting, generate quantitative research content, and improve CRM processes & data accuracy. This is an important role in the execution of several S&W strategic initiatives (inbound lead generation, creating & improving proprietary data sets, and modernizing business intelligence & reporting practices).




Key Responsibilities:

(30%) In conjunction with the COO, analyze, summarize, & interpret large data sets for internal and external use using Excel, PowerBI, & PowerPoint
(25%) Capture, clean, organize, & integrate open-source data into proprietary data sets for S&W research & marketing projects
(25%) CRM – Report on end user adherence to CRM data entry standards & enhance historical data to reach this standard
(10%) Performing one-off analyses at the request of the COO or S&W leadership
(10%) Maintain an accurate & timely record of business metrics




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, etc.) or 2+ years of relevant job experience
Proficiency in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, R, etc.)
Advanced Excel skills, including vlookup, pivot tables, and compound formulas (if, sumif, countif)
Familiarity with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Familiarity with PowerPoint for data presentation and reporting




Preferred Skills:

Experience writing Python script for web scraping
Basic knowledge of statistics and data visualization techniques
Ability to work independently and juggle multiple initiatives simultaneously




Personal Attributes:

A team player who communicates proactively and delivers on deadlines
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Integrity, strong work ethic, & a growth mindset

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for experienced and passionate Data Analysts to join one of our agile analytics teams. Our ideal candidate is adept at modeling complex data, uncovering patterns, and delivering data-driven insights to help grow our business effectively and efficiently.




In this role you’ll be a strategic partner, working closely with senior department leaders to define and execute data analytics strategies.




In this role you’ll




Be part of the Analytics chapter, spending your day-to-day as the data expert in either our finance, compliance, insurance & actuarial (FCIA) team, or analytics enablement team
Build and maintain the data analytics infrastructure for accurate and timely reporting and sophisticated analysis
Set measurable and strategic goals, and build new measurement and optimization capabilities
Initiate analyses and deliver business insights that lead directly to process and product improvements
Partner with other data analysts, as well as team members from R&D, Biz Ops, Insurance Product, Actuarial, and Finance to push through cross-functional data projects




What you’ll need




3+ years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably within a fast-growing consumer company
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Proficiency in SQL is essential, knowledge of Python or R, a plus
Proficiency in data visualization is essential, knowledge of Looker, a plus
Hands-on experience with modern data analytics stack (e.g. Snowflake, dbt, Looker, Git),strongly preferred
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with others
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture




*Please note that we are unable to sponsor applicants for work visas




Lemonade's US base salary range for this full-time position is $90,000- $120,000 equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Speak to your recruiter to hear more about the specific salary range for your preferred location.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Functional Analyst

Duration: 6 Month(s), Contract to Hire

Location: Cincinnati, OH

Information

Top 3 Skills:

R (data cleaning, performing calculations on large datasets, performing exploratory data analysis). You will also use Python on occasion.

PowerBI (especially with DAX). Almost all of the data reporting is done in Power BI. Working with Power Query, Dataflows, Row Level Security (RLS) and writing measures with DAX will be a big part of your job.

A great eye for visualization and a focus on the user experience. Our team attaches a lot of importance to making our reports nice looking and user friendly.

Remote candidates will be considered.




Job Description

- Assist with the maintenance of daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly business reporting functions.

- Gather Retail Operations data from multiple databases, platforms, stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors to complete analyze.

- Transform large data sets through data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.

- Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations in large data sets.

- Implement row level security in the Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to enable secured viewing of the reports for designated job levels and locations.

- Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the data needs to execute department and enterprise-wide strategic objectives and initiatives.

- Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and the team.

- Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

• Standardize and solidify data processes and quality

• Assist in developing business reporting

• Increase data availability, standardization and automation processes

• Problem solve and investigate issues

• Participate in all phases of system testing Work successfully in an Agile Project across multiple feature and component teams

• Complete estimates and work plans in Program Increments (PI) Meetings as appropriate for design, development, implementation and rollout tasks

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Trainee




About the Program:

People Tech Technology is pleased to offer a comprehensive Data Training Program designed for individuals looking to start a career in data science and analytics. This program aims to equip participants with the essential skills and knowledge required to become proficient data professionals.

Key Responsibilities:

Training Participation: Attend and actively engage in all training sessions, workshops, and assignments.
Learning and Development: Utilize training materials, complete exercises, and participate in discussions to deepen understanding of data science and analytics concepts.
Project Work: Apply learned skills by working on real-world projects and assignments with guidance from experienced mentors.
Data Analysis: Conduct data cleaning, analysis, and visualization using various tools and techniques.
Collaboration: Work collaboratively with peers and mentors to foster a productive learning environment.
Feedback and Improvement: Provide and receive constructive feedback to and from peers and mentors to continually improve skills and program experience.

What You Will Learn:

Data Fundamentals: Understanding data types, data collection, and data cleaning techniques.
Statistics and Probability: Basic concepts of statistics and probability used in data analysis.
Programming for Data Science: Using programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.
Data Visualization: Creating visualizations using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Tableau.
Machine Learning: Introduction to machine learning concepts, algorithms, and model evaluation.
Big Data Technologies: Understanding big data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark.
SQL and Databases: Writing SQL queries and understanding database management.
Data Storytelling: Communicating insights effectively through data storytelling and presentation.

Qualifications:

Education: Masters in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field (or currently pursuing one).
Basic Programming Knowledge: Familiarity with basic programming concepts, preferably in any programming language.
Passion for Data: Demonstrated interest in data science and analytics.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Skills (Not Mandatory):

Prior Experience with Data: Any prior experience with data analysis or related fields is a plus.
Knowledge of Statistics: Basic understanding of statistical concepts and methods.

Benefits:

Hands-on Training: Gain practical experience through real-world projects.
Mentorship: Receive guidance and support from experienced data professionals.
Career Opportunities: Potential for full-time employment opportunities upon successful completion of the program.
Networking: Connect with industry professionals and like-minded peers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be important in driving data-driven decision-making within ERAS in the ERAS Data Services team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting data to uncover valuable insights and support strategic initiatives. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable recommendations will be instrumental in helping us to optimize our operations in providing services to the fellowship and residency recruitment space. Must work East Coast business hours.

Essential Duties

Data Collection and Cleaning


Collect data from various sources (databases, APIs, files)
Clean and prepare data for analysis (removing duplicates, handling missing values, formatting data)


Data Analysis


Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Use data mining and machine learning algorithms to uncover hidden insights
Apply statistical techniques (e.g., descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, regression analysis)


Data Visualization


Create visualizations (charts, graphs, dashboards) to communicate data findings effectively
Select appropriate visualization techniques based on the data and audience


Reporting


Develop and deliver regular reports and presentations to stakeholders
Summarize key findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner


Problem Solving


Identify and solve data-related problems using analytical and technical skills
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address data challenges


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
3-5 years of experience in data analysis
Strong proficiency in SQL and data manipulation tools
Knowledge of statistical software (e.g., R, Python) is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is beneficial
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

HTML:
As a Data Analyst, you will be important in driving data-driven decision-making within ERAS in the ERAS Data Services team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting data to uncover valuable insights and support strategic initiatives. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable recommendations will be instrumental in helping us to optimize our operations in providing services to the fellowship and residency recruitment space. Must work East Coast business hours.

Essential Duties

Data Collection and Cleaning

  • Collect data from various sources (databases, APIs, files)
  • Clean and prepare data for analysis (removing duplicates, handling missing values, formatting data)

Data Analysis

  • Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
  • Use data mining and machine learning algorithms to uncover hidden insights
  • Apply statistical techniques (e.g., descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, regression analysis)

Data Visualization

  • Create visualizations (charts, graphs, dashboards) to communicate data findings effectively
  • Select appropriate visualization techniques based on the data and audience

Reporting

  • Develop and deliver regular reports and presentations to stakeholders
  • Summarize key findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner

Problem Solving

  • Identify and solve data-related problems using analytical and technical skills
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address data challenges

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
  • 3-5 years of experience in data analysis
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and data manipulation tools
  • Knowledge of statistical software (e.g., R, Python) is a plus
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is beneficial
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Title: Data Analyst (Linguistics)
Description:
As a Data Analyst on the Linguistics Team, you will be responsible for managing languages assigned to you based on your fluency. Your role involves developing and maintaining these languages to meet Lightcast standards and supporting the creation of new features for various products.

Major Responsibilities:


Analyze and improve data quality of multilingual text classifiers
Work with linguistics and engineering teams to build out new parsers across languages
Translate various taxonomies such as Skills, Titles, and Occupations
Create crosswalks from origin language titles and skills to Lightcast taxonomies
Use SQL for data handling and database management


Education and Experience:


Bachelor's degree in Linguistics, Data Analytics, NLP, or a related field (preferred)
Familiarity with multinational labor markets (preferred)Strong expertise in linguistics
Proficiency in three or more languages
Solid understanding of syntax and language structure analysis
Experience with Microsoft Excel (vlookups, data cleaning, functions)
Knowledge of query languages like SQL
Understanding of text analysis and machine learning principles
Experience with data analysis tools such as Excel or Python
Proficiency in using RegEx


Lightcast is a global leader in labor market insights with headquarters in Moscow (ID) with offices in the United Kingdom, Europe, and India. We work with partners across six continents to help drive economic prosperity and mobility by providing the insights needed to build and develop our people, our institutions and companies, and our communities. Lightcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Lightcast has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. We seek dynamic professionals from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven Data Analyst with a passion for storytelling through data to join our team. This role is ideal for an early-career professional with 1-3 years of experience who is comfortable parsing large datasets and deriving insights to inform business goals. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you’ll leverage SQL, Excel, and BigQuery to analyze data patterns, determine platform usage, and drive recommendations. You’ll need to be both analytically proficient and a strong communicator, able to share findings with leadership in a way that’s clear, actionable, and strategic.

RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, or related field.
1-3 years of experience in data analysis, with a proven ability to extract insights from data using SQL and Excel
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in an easily understandable way.
Experience creating presentations and visualizations to showcase findings and insights.
Self-motivated, organized, and comfortable in a dynamic, collaborative environment.

Title: Data Analyst, Trust and Safety, Ads
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Kirkland, WA, USA; Austin, TX, USA.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in data analytics, Trust and Safety, policy, cybersecurity, or related fields.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with machine learning.
Experience in SQL, building dashboards, data collection/transformation, visualization/dashboards, or scripting/programming language (e.g., Python).
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence cross-functionally at various levels.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills with attention to detail in an ever-changing environment.


About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, Google Ads and AdSense.

In this role, you will partner with the Engineering, Product, Legal, Policy and Scaled Operations team to drive operational performance and lower abuse rates. You will enable effectiveness and efficiency by driving strategic intent and execution excellence to deliver cross-functional initiatives at scale and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $108,000-$158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Design and implement integrations between business objectives and business systems, including designing and building strategies that support these business systems.
Conduct strategic analysis, optimize business performance, and deliver within relevant product areas. This includes analyzing data, identifying trends, and developing solutions that improve business performance.
Manage projects involving multiple stakeholders, tight timelines, important organizational implications, and changing circumstances.
Use Google’s big data to conduct data-oriented analysis, architect metrics, synthesize information, solve problems, and influence business decision-making by presenting insights and market trends.
Perform on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis, including weekend coverage/holidays. Work with sensitive content or situations and be exposed to graphic, controversial, or upsetting topics or content.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
In order to be considered for this role, after clicking "Apply Now" above and being redirected, you must fully complete the application process on the follow-up screen.

If you are interested in sports jobs with the New Orleans Saints and Pelicans, you’re in the right place!

Who We Are

The mission of the New Orleans Saints and New Orleans Pelicans is to be #1 in everything we do and to be a global brand to all of our fans. We take pride in the growth and success of the entire Gulf Coast region and are committed to leveraging our resources and goodwill to foster meaningful change for the greater good of society and our community. We celebrate individuality and value all identities and experiences, and value the perspectives of our team members. Our team members are integral to our success, and we stand beside them through success and hardship. We make it a priority to make all team members feel included and their opinions be heard. Together, we win!

Who You Are

You want to be part of a team that values community, integrity, excellence, and an organization where people come first and are celebrated. You love the industry of sports, and are excited by the potential of working for two major leagues, the NFL and the NBA. You understand and appreciate that New Orleans is a unique city with so much to offer, and you want to be a part of the vibrant community that wants to see it’s teams be the best. You are passionate, driven, and ready to work hard and have fun.

Position Summary

The Saints and Pelicans’ Consumer Insights department is looking for a talented analyst who is passionate about designing, crafting, and operating automated analytical solutions that will drive scientific data-driven decision making and have direct and measurable positive impact to both the New Orleans Saints and the New Orleans Pelicans, as well as other Benson Businesses and their customers.

As a Consumer Insights Analyst, you will play an important role in the Business Intelligence function and support Ticket Sales, Marketing, Digital Media, Corporate Partnerships, and other related departments and business units. This position will take the lead in providing key metrics, insights and recommendations for pricing analytics and forecasting as well as be responsible for specific reports and dashboards to be distributed across departments and senior executives.

As a key member of the team, you will own and manage projects, use advanced and evolving methods to solve business problems, and meet business leaders across the company to deliver actionable insights and tangible business value.

What You Will Be Doing

Specific duties include, but are not limited to:


Build and maintain reports and dashboards to measure, monitor and analyze demand, supply, elasticities, and other metrics
Assist with pricing analytics, revenue forecasting, and competition analysis in the market
Work closely across the Consumer Insights department to acquire and integrate data from various businesses and data sources
Analyze local and regional market data from Bloomberg, Moody’s Analytics, Census, Bureau of Labor Statistics, Nielsen, and YouGov to forecast demand and assess pricing trends for various products
Build and maintain reports, dashboards, and data visualizations that are focused on local and regional trends
Support the analysis of digital/social content assets, pricing strategies, and customer / fan behaviors across digital channels
Design and build datasets and statistical models for pricing analytics, revenue projections, etc.
Build reports and dashboards to monitor and analyze data warehouse performance to provide insight to front-end users
Build reports and dashboards to monitor and analyze the quality of data in the data warehouse to support sales and marketing campaigns
Support ETL projects that integrate various data sources into the data warehouse
Document and build visuals of conceptual architecture for each database in the data warehouse
Other projects and duties as assigned


What You’ll Bring


Bachelor’s degree in in Economics, Business Analytics, or a related field
Proven data analytics experience is required
Highly analytical person with strong problem-solving skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Knowledge and experience with Microeconomics concepts and strategies, and experience with pricing and forecasting analytics
Minimum 2 years’ experience with SQL and PowerBI
Proven strong Mathematics capabilities
Strong communication and organization skills required
Highly self-motivated individual with excellent teamwork
Project management experience is a plus
Advanced Excel skills is a plus
Advanced PowerBI, SQL and Python experience is a plus
Statistical Analysis and Modeling experience is a plus
Experience within the sports industry is not required, but is a plus


Working Conditions


Typical office environment
Working schedule/hours will ebb and flow with NFL/NBA schedule, and will include working some late hours, holidays, nights, and weekends


What We Offer


Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance options
401K with employer contributions
Paid parental leave
PTO and paid holidays
Wellness Program


Applications must be submitted online. Please do not mail or email resumes to the Saints/Pelicans. All qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or by email. Please do not contact the Saints/Pelicans Human Resources or Hiring Manager to check the status of your application. When applying, please be sure your updated contact information is provided.

The New Orleans Saints and New Orleans Pelicans ("Teams") are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for candidates and employees regardless of their membership in any protected classifications. The Teams will not discriminate in violation of the law on the basis of race, color, age, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, and pregnancy), religion, physical or mental disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence, and/or any other legally protected class under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This anti-discrimination policy applies with respect to all employment decisions, including but not limited to hiring, promotion, discipline, and discharge. The Teams are committed to equal opportunity for persons with disabilities in compliance with the Americans Disabilities Act and state law. If you feel you need an accommodation for a disability, please inform us. Requests for accommodation will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis. If you request an accommodation, it is essential that you participate fully in the interactive process.

  • Minimum 2 years’ experience with SQL and PowerBI
  • Proven strong Mathematics capabilities
  • Strong communication and organization skills required
  • Highly self-motivated individual with excellent teamwork
  • Project management experience is a plus
  • Advanced Excel skills is a plus
  • Advanced PowerBI, SQL and Python experience is a plus
  • Statistical Analysis and Modeling experience is a plus
  • Experience within the sports industry is not required, but is a plus

  • Typical office environment
  • Working schedule/hours will ebb and flow with NFL/NBA schedule, and will include working some late hours, holidays, nights, and weekends

  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance options
  • 401K with employer contributions
  • Paid parental leave
  • PTO and paid holidays
  • Wellness Program

Title: Analista de datos Digital
Description:
Descripción General del Puesto:

El Analista de Datos Digital es responsable de analizar y procesar datos de campañas digitales y redes sociales para generar insights accionables que optimicen nuestras estrategias de marketing y mejoren el rendimiento de las campañas. Con un enfoque en la identificación de patrones, oportunidades de mejora y recomendaciones basadas en datos, esta posición es clave para guiar la toma de decisiones en tiempo real y asegurar un impacto positivo en nuestros resultados.




Responsabilidades:

Recopilación y Análisis de Datos: Extraer y procesar información de plataformas digitales y redes sociales (Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, TikTok Analytics, entre otras).
Evaluación de Métricas de Rendimiento: Analizar el rendimiento de las campañas, identificando tendencias, patrones y áreas de mejora.
Provisión de Insights Estratégicos: Proporcionar insights que optimicen campañas y guíen decisiones clave en marketing.
Elaboración de Reportes y Dashboards: Crear reportes visuales y dashboards interactivos con herramientas como Tableau y Power BI.
Optimización de Campañas en Tiempo Real: Colaborar con equipos operativos para ajustar campañas según KPIs y resultados.
Investigación de Nuevas Tendencias: Explorar nuevas técnicas de análisis y tendencias en marketing digital.
Desarrollo de Modelos Predictivos: Aplicar modelos predictivos para anticipar el comportamiento de campañas y mejorar la toma de decisiones.
Actualización Continua: Mantenerse al día con herramientas y metodologías emergentes en análisis de datos.




Requisitos:

Experiencia: 2-3 años en análisis de datos de marketing o en roles similares.
Habilidades Técnicas: Dominio de Google Analytics, Tableau/Power BI, Excel y plataformas de anuncios en redes sociales (Facebook Ads, TikTok Ads).
Habilidades Analíticas: Capacidad avanzada para procesar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer insights relevantes.
Pensamiento Crítico: Habilidad para evaluar y cuestionar datos, proponiendo soluciones estratégicas innovadoras.
Comunicación Eficaz: Capacidad para traducir datos complejos en insights claros y accionables para equipos multidisciplinarios.
Autodidacta: Capacidad para aprender nuevas herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos de manera independiente.

Show more

  • Comunicación Eficaz: Capacidad para traducir datos complejos en insights claros y accionables para equipos multidisciplinarios.
  • Autodidacta: Capacidad para aprender nuevas herramientas y técnicas de análisis de datos de manera independiente.

Title: Data Analyst (100% Remote)
Description:
Who we are:

Since our founding in 2011, our mission has been to improve the lives of seniors and their caregivers. We are deeply passionate about communication and committed to becoming the foremost provider of services and solutions that enable seniors to lead more meaningful and independent lives. We also understand the power of connection and the profound impact it has on the lives of individuals who are hard-of-hearing. By utilizing enhanced automatic speech recognition, human captioning, and innovative product development, we deliver easy-to-use, cutting-edge technology to our primarily senior customer base. Our near real-time phone captioning technology allows individuals with hearing loss to see what callers are saying, enabling them to regain their connection to the world.

ClearCaptions is a Federal Communications Commission (FCC)-certified telephone captioning provider, adhering to the highest industry standards of privacy, security, and professionalism. We recognize the importance of maintaining the trust and confidence of our customers, and we continually strive to exceed their expectations.

For more information about our services please visit clearcaptions.com .

Position Summary:

Are you passionate about data, excited by opportunities for deep-dive analysis, and driven by a curiosity to understand cross-functional business analytics? Are you looking for an exciting opportunity with a mission-driven organization dedicated to improving lives? ClearCaptions is seeking a talented, results-driven Data Analyst to join our dynamic, insights-focused team. In this role, you will collaborate with key organizational leaders, including the C-suite, to deliver cohesive, rigorous, and insightful reporting tools and in-depth analyses that facilitate data-driven decision making. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, the ability to translate data into meaningful and actionable business recommendations that connect to higher-level business objectives, and a desire to partner with stakeholders to cultivate a culture of data literacy and democratization. Exceptional candidates will be energized by the opportunity to serve as a thought-partner, problem-solver, and bridge between technical and non-technical teams.

This is a Remote/Work from Home position reporting to the Director of Business Insights.

What you will do:


Work collaboratively with internal teams to solve cross-functional business challenges and provide key insights that drive improvement for both our business and our customers.
Translate analyses into actionable, data-backed recommendations and summary of expected results.
Analyze operational initiatives to measure their effectiveness and impact on key performance indicators (KPIs) for both the functional department and the overall business.
Enable visibility and in-depth understanding of existing performance; recommend optimizations to processes based on a data-driven orientation and analysis of expected results.
Develop, refine, and leverage cross-functional dashboards and reports to provide timely data for decision-making as well as regular updates on performance to stakeholders.
Collect, integrate, and interpret cross-functional and disparate date sets for holistic insights and recommendations as well as impact on business value.
Evaluate the performance of processes to increase customer acquisition, retention, and adoption while ensuring we maintain excellence in customer service, integrity, and efficiency of resources.
Adjust and optimize metrics and reporting to develop deeper organizational understanding of year-over-year pacing and progress against goals.
Leverage advanced analytics modeling in regression, forecasting, segmentation, or similar for significant and rigorous business and insights.
Be a key partner with our internal team members to refine and optimize performance. 
Support A/B Test design and execution; lead analysis of test data and delivery of actionable results.
Maintain a detailed understanding of platforms, data structures and services to become a reliable source for the organization and contribute to the evolution of analytics capabilities and frameworks.
Partner closely with Data Engineering and Data Governance to communicate and collaborate on complex data needs and projects to support business requirements, automation initiatives, and opportunities.
Generate regular and ad hoc reports for leadership and key stakeholders to support the business.
Work to continually optimize internal processes to achieve operational excellence.
Maintain data dictionaries, data catalogs, event mapping, and documentation of data sources.
Ensure data security and compliance with data privacy regulations.


The kind of people we look for:


Versatile people who thrive on variety and challenge
Excited about working in a fast-paced environment
Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture
Takes initiative, pushes boundaries, motivated to innovate
Talented individuals with a growth mindset who want to use their learning and relationship-building skills
Align with our company core values: Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Service and Quality


Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Business, Economics, Statistics, Analytics) or equivalent experience.
3-5 years in a role with demonstrated analytical background and expertise (e.g., data analysis, business analytics, statistical analysis, forecasting/demand management).
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, DAX, Python, and/or R with advanced skill in Excel.
Strong data visualization skills using Power BI and/or Tableau.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and data analysis techniques, including evaluation of ROI and attribution.
Demonstrated proficiency across a range of technologies related to data visualization, operational platforms, Salesforce data, and analysis of large and complex data sets.
Experience analyzing and reporting data to identify issues, trends, or opportunities in a meaningful way to a variety of audiences.
Experience collaborating with business unit leaders for requirements gathering and refinement of key business needs and questions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation, and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter with strong organizational and time management skills, self-directed and able to handle multiple priorities with demanding timeframes.
Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and staff to create a high-quality, results-driven, team environment built on trust and respect.
Demonstrated ability as a self-starter, able to work independently, make sound decisions, and use discretion.
Willingness and ability to occasionally work flexible hours as needed.
Proficient in MS Office, modern communication tools for virtual teams (i.e., MS Teams, SharePoint, Jira, Slack).


Physical Demands:

Employees may experience the following physical demands for extended periods of time:


Sitting, standing, and walking (95-100%)
Keyboarding (40-60%)
Viewing computer monitor, tablet and cell phone screen requiring close vision (95-100%)


Work Environment:

100% Remote: Work environment is at home.

Compensation :

$81,000 - $102,000 prospectively with consideration to experience and geographical location . Please see www.clearcaptions.com/careers for an overview of our generous benefits program.

Intrigued to learn more?

When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.

ClearCaptions is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion and diversity. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

Disclaimer:

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to do this job.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Are you a data-driven professional with a passion for uncovering insights?




Join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you'll leverage your analytical skills to transform raw data into actionable insights that support our business objectives.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Insights: Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Data Visualization: Create compelling visualizations (dashboards, reports) to communicate insights effectively.
Data Cleansing and Preparation: Ensure data accuracy and consistency through cleaning and transformation processes.
Process Improvement: Identify and implement process improvements to enhance data quality and efficiency.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions.
Tool Proficiency: Utilize tools like Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Python to extract, analyze, and visualize data.




Qualifications:

Experience: 2-4 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL, data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI), and programming languages (Python, R).
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to uncover insights from data.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey complex information clearly.
Domain Knowledge: Understanding of the staffing industry and MSP operations is a plus.




Join our team and make a lasting impact!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
QuaverEd is a rapidly growing education technology company located on Music Row in Nashville, Tennessee. We specialize in online educational software for Music, Heath and PE, Pre-K, and SEL. 




We are seeking a highly motivated Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a passion for working with data, and the ability to derive actionable insights that drive decision-making. 

 

Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field preferred.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to handle large datasets.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data findings in a clear, understandable way.
Enthusiasm for learning and adapting in a fast-paced environment.




Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure data quality and accuracy.
Conduct data analysis using statistical techniques and interpret trends to support business decisions.
Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present insights in a clear, concise manner.
Assist in identifying patterns, correlations, and anomalies within large datasets.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and support their initiatives with relevant insights.
Maintain documentation of data processes, methodologies, and findings.
Participate in special projects as needed.




The person must be located in the Nashville, TN area.




If you do not meet all of our requirements but feel confident in your abilities and/or experience, please apply anyway.




QuaverEd, Inc. offers an excellent benefits package including, 80 hours of vacation per year, 12 paid holidays, 60 hours of sick leave, subsidized health care up to $7,200 per year, subsidized life insurance, a 401(k) program with no participation fees, and a collegial, supporting atmosphere.

QuaverEd, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, or genetic information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Compensation: To $85K.

Job Overview – Data Analyst – 33284

This opportunity is in-office and in Charlotte, NC. Our client does not offer relocation at this time.

In this role, you will be responsible for the build, support, and maintenance of the Tableau data reporting environment. This position works with end-users to ensure accuracy of data collected and reported. Develops, interprets, and implements complex financial and accounting concepts, or techniques for financial planning and control.

Requirements

2-4 years experience in a Data Analyst role
Experience maintaining dashboards and reporting, date source collection and aggregation, testing for data and software continuity, interpret data and investigate trends
Tableau & SQL required
Python, R, Snowflake preferred
Team player, "Get it Done" work mentality
Attention to Detail
Bachelor's Degree

Additional Job Details

Workplace Policy:

Seniority Level: Associate

Linked In Poster:

About Our Process

We will notify you if you are selected as a candidate for this role. If not, but you fit our specializations, we'll consider you for future openings, and encourage you to apply for other Sherpa roles you're qualified for/interested in.
Non-Local Candidates: Please note that you are competing with local candidates who don’t require relocation expenses and can start quickly, so let us know if you have plans to move to the area soon.
Candidates for all Sherpa opportunities must be authorized to work in the United States.
Sherpa is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking Data/Support Analysts that can face interesting challenges in a fast-paced environment and aren't afraid to get their hands dirty working with large, disparate data sets, developing complex reporting solutions, and streamlining processes through automation. As a member of the team, you will work closely with other Business and Data Analysts to gain fluency in capital market concepts and become familiar with financial services operations. Our ideal candidates are intellectually curious, self-motivated, and ready to contribute wherever the need arises.

Responsibilities

Research data issues involving large volumes of data stored in various systems
Troubleshoot problems loading data from automated data feeds
Identify repetitive problems and develop permanent solutions
Develop a working understanding of financial concepts related to client data and reporting
Collaborate with business stakeholders and 3rd parties to develop technical solutions that support business processes
Develop client-facing reports based on client requests using proprietary reporting tools
Use SQL to make deeper dives into complex issues to trace problems back to root cause
Work collaboratively in a rapidly growing team
Actively participate in ongoing development and maintenance of our Knowledge Base repository
Some travel to local client offices may be required


Qualifications

Enjoys working with numbers and data in various formats
Pays attention to detail and takes ownership and pride in delivering quality work outputs
Adapts quickly in fast-paced environments, possessing excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable communicating effectively (written and verbal) as well as working with a team
Takes initiative and ownership of job responsibilities and performs duties accurately and timely
Self-motivated, self-starter, and challenge-seeker
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, or related analytical field with 0-2 years of relevant work experience
US Citizen or Permanent Resident eligible to work in the US without sponsorship


Desired Skills

Fluency with Microsoft Office software, especially Excel
Working knowledge of basic programming concepts desired
Prior Experience with SQL query language in either SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL preferred
Prior Experience with Capital Markets or Finance industry experience preferred


Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.




Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more.




Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.
