Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Genesis10 is seeking a Data Analyst for a 6-month remote contract position with a leading client. The target hourly W2 pay rate is between $50-60/HR W2 based on experience. Candidates applying must be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder and able to work on a W2 basis directly with Genesis10.

Job Description:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for data mapping, required to deliver vital information to the consumer population for multiple data assets.

Job Duties:


Owns the attribution mapping details for data elements from the source systems to the target analytics data assets and Wealth-specific data solutions including, but not limited to star marts, extracts, hierarchies, and point-to-point solutions to support Wealth domain assets.
Independently translates business requirements to detailed mapping documents, develops and unit tests datasets building maintainable code to accelerate delivery through reusability, and performs peer code reviews.
Embraces mentorship and provides training for less experienced business and data analysts.
Provides continuous improvement ideas to reduce expenses, improve efficiency, and elevate quality.
Assesses the technical viability of new and emerging data solutions providing design guidance, technical recommendations, performance optimization, and development insights.
Contributes to technical documentation, specifications, and project artifacts for developing data solutions.
Adheres to and identifies standards and best practices to be extended beyond the Foundational Analytics and Wealth Squad.
Give input into Data Models and Entity Relationship Diagrams and use those documents to build efficient SQL.
Create and enhance context diagrams for data solutions to maintain auditability.
Provide all the business rules, transformation logic, derived column expressions, SQL, etc. to build mapping documents.
Participate and give feedback in Mapping Review Sessions and Data Architecture Review Sessions.


Requirements:


Data mapping and modeling experience
SQL, SAS and Python experience
Knowledge of portfolio planning, project prioritization, and remediation planning activities.
Strong knowledge of Risk Management practices associated with Financial Institution or financial data.
Education: Master's Degree and 4+ years data analytics experience, Bachelor's Degree and 7+ years data analytics experience, or equivalent military/work experience.
Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in Google Cloud Platform, notable Big Query.
Experience programming in SQL, SAS and Python.
Experience in data mapping and modeling.


Preferred Experience:


Experience with Agile Methodologies, Jira, Confluence, Miro, and Asana.
Experience working with Wealth Systems including Envestnet, Pershing, GlobalPlus, and Omnipay Nextgen or similar products is highly preferred.
Extensive experience analyzing and interpreting business data leveraging various techniques including automation for data quality validations.
Experience in AbInitio or AbInitio Spectograph.
Experience working with APIs and a solution orchestration layer is a plus.


If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

HTML:
Genesis10 is seeking a Data Analyst for a 6-month remote contract position with a leading client. The target hourly W2 pay rate is between $50-60/HR W2 based on experience. Candidates applying must be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder and able to work on a W2 basis directly with Genesis10.

Job Description:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for data mapping, required to deliver vital information to the consumer population for multiple data assets.

Job Duties:

  • Owns the attribution mapping details for data elements from the source systems to the target analytics data assets and Wealth-specific data solutions including, but not limited to star marts, extracts, hierarchies, and point-to-point solutions to support Wealth domain assets.
  • Independently translates business requirements to detailed mapping documents, develops and unit tests datasets building maintainable code to accelerate delivery through reusability, and performs peer code reviews.
  • Embraces mentorship and provides training for less experienced business and data analysts.
  • Provides continuous improvement ideas to reduce expenses, improve efficiency, and elevate quality.
  • Assesses the technical viability of new and emerging data solutions providing design guidance, technical recommendations, performance optimization, and development insights.
  • Contributes to technical documentation, specifications, and project artifacts for developing data solutions.
  • Adheres to and identifies standards and best practices to be extended beyond the Foundational Analytics and Wealth Squad.
  • Give input into Data Models and Entity Relationship Diagrams and use those documents to build efficient SQL.
  • Create and enhance context diagrams for data solutions to maintain auditability.
  • Provide all the business rules, transformation logic, derived column expressions, SQL, etc. to build mapping documents.
  • Participate and give feedback in Mapping Review Sessions and Data Architecture Review Sessions.

Requirements:

  • Data mapping and modeling experience
  • SQL, SAS and Python experience
  • Knowledge of portfolio planning, project prioritization, and remediation planning activities.
  • Strong knowledge of Risk Management practices associated with Financial Institution or financial data.
  • Education: Master's Degree and 4+ years data analytics experience, Bachelor's Degree and 7+ years data analytics experience, or equivalent military/work experience.
  • Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience in Google Cloud Platform, notable Big Query.
  • Experience programming in SQL, SAS and Python.
  • Experience in data mapping and modeling.

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience with Agile Methodologies, Jira, Confluence, Miro, and Asana.
  • Experience working with Wealth Systems including Envestnet, Pershing, GlobalPlus, and Omnipay Nextgen or similar products is highly preferred.
  • Extensive experience analyzing and interpreting business data leveraging various techniques including automation for data quality validations.
  • Experience in AbInitio or AbInitio Spectograph.
  • Experience working with APIs and a solution orchestration layer is a plus.

If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Ascendion:

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.




Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life:

We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

Build the coolest tech for the world’s leading brands
Solve complex problems - and learn new skills
Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience




Experience a community of change-makers!




Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.




About the Role: 100% Remote Role - Business Data Analyst




Job Title: Business Data Analyst




Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst responsible for application domain analysis of the projects under the control or influenced by the Commerce, Enterprise and Engineering Group. Helps to coordinate tasks for developers by updating tickets as to status, advice, testing progress, and urgency. Assist in training and meet with business experts to analyze requirements for support and development of upgrades, new releases, and rollout of programs or systems. Helps in identifying and documenting system enhancements to control costs, increase revenue, time savings, or standardization of policies as well as define test criteria, preparation and compilation of test cases, analysis of results, and validation of Systems in support of project and company objectives. Responsible for maintaining deadlines, communicating with leadership and vendors, as well as delivery of projects on time and on budget.




Responsibilities

Run data analysis across various business areas.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define business needs and data requirements.
Interpret data trends and provide strategic recommendations to senior management.
Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and company policies.
Analyze expected data inputs and outputs from AI models, ensuring accurate insights.




Minimum Qualifications:

5-7 years of experience as a Business Data Analyst across various business areas.
Proficient in Power BI, SQL, DAX, Power Query. Data modeling and proficiency in Python/Pandas is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics or Statistics, or a related field.
Proven ability to analyze AI model data and produce actionable insights.
Full professional proficiency in English, including native-level fluency.




Location: 100% Remote




Salary Range: The salary for this position is between $80000/year - $100000/year USD. Factors that may affect pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.




Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: [medical insurance] [dental insurance] [vision insurance] [401(k) retirement plan] [long-term disability insurance] [short-term disability insurance] [5 personal days accrued each calendar year. The Paid time off benefits meet the paid sick and safe time laws that pertain to the City/ State] [10-15 days of paid vacation time] [6 paid holidays and 1 floating holiday per calendar year] [Ascendion Learning Management System]




Want to change the world? Let us know.




Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let’s talk!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Data Analyst

Location: South Portland, ME

Reports To: Chief Operating Officer




Position Summary: The Data Analyst will utilize a generalist data analytics skillset to significantly impact S&W’s internal business reporting, generate quantitative research content, and improve CRM processes & data accuracy. This is an important role in the execution of several S&W strategic initiatives (inbound lead generation, creating & improving proprietary data sets, and modernizing business intelligence & reporting practices).




Key Responsibilities:

(30%) In conjunction with the COO, analyze, summarize, & interpret large data sets for internal and external use using Excel, PowerBI, & PowerPoint
(25%) Capture, clean, organize, & integrate open-source data into proprietary data sets for S&W research & marketing projects
(25%) CRM – Report on end user adherence to CRM data entry standards & enhance historical data to reach this standard
(10%) Performing one-off analyses at the request of the COO or S&W leadership
(10%) Maintain an accurate & timely record of business metrics




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, etc.) or 2+ years of relevant job experience
Proficiency in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Python, R, etc.)
Advanced Excel skills, including vlookup, pivot tables, and compound formulas (if, sumif, countif)
Familiarity with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Familiarity with PowerPoint for data presentation and reporting




Preferred Skills:

Experience writing Python script for web scraping
Basic knowledge of statistics and data visualization techniques
Ability to work independently and juggle multiple initiatives simultaneously




Personal Attributes:

A team player who communicates proactively and delivers on deadlines
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Integrity, strong work ethic, & a growth mindset

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO IS RATEHUB?

We’re a company on a mission - We are a unique Canadian Fintech that is the one stop shop for all financial needs of the consumer - Save, Spend, Borrow, Invest, and Protect. Every single team member, from product & engineering to sales & marketing, finance, operations, and everything in between is obsessed with one thing; helping Canadians make better financial choices. And we’re pretty great at it, too. Via our digital application technology and our award-winning in-house brokerages, we help over 2M Canadians per month make a positive impact on their finances. We have many unique businesses - a mortgage brokerage, a life insurance brokerage, a home and auto insurance brokerage, a mortgage originations and servicing business, a Financial Services Marketplace and a content business across Ratehub and MoneySense. 365 days a year we deliver our users the best online mortgage experience, personalized Credit Card and Loans options, and cheaper auto & home insurance policies than they typically get from their existing financial adviser.

Changing how people make financial choices isn’t easy, though. We know that achieving our mission is full of challenges; challenges that can be complex and often unexpected, but that are always interesting, rewarding, and fun to solve as a team. This is where you come in. We are on the hunt for the right kind of people to join us and help lead us forward to continued growth.

We have a newly created Data Team that is capturing data, analyzing it, harvesting it, modeling it to provide meaningful insights to our Members and to our businesses. We’re looking for a top performing Data Analyst to join this team, which will be the backbone of all the businesses (based in downtown Toronto but also open to remote candidates)! Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst is a critical member of Ratehub’s team who will drive decision making across the company. You will work on high impact projects with business stakeholders and will need to use data to solve long-term and immediate business problems. The role will involve data analysis, modeling and insights development. The ideal candidate has strong communications skills, a passion for data, a background in quantitative analysis and an interest in personal finance. You will get the opportunity to work closely with the other analysts in the team as well as the business stakeholders to learn different parts of the business and provide valuable support with data reporting and analysis across various business units.

Your Responsibilities


Lead end to end analytics workflow to deliver analysis which is statistically sound and understandable for non technical stakeholders
Own the design, development and maintenance of business metrics and KPI dashboards proactively discussing emerging trends along with recommendations with business stakeholders
Support in developing and maintaining our data model by understanding key data sources and relationships between them
Collaborate with business partners on experimentation design and a/b testing
Drive org wide impact by shaping business strategy through data centric analysis and presentations


Your Qualifications


2+ years of relevant work experience
Post-secondary degree: We value intelligence over relevance, but a Bachelors in Computer Science would be looked upon favourably
High proficiency with SQL for data analysis
Strong understanding of BI & reporting tools e.g. Looker, Tableau, Sisense, QlikView
Knowledge of Python or R is considered an asset
Experience with a web analytics tool to support product and marketing analysis will be an asset
Exposure to cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure or GCP is nice to have


BEYOND THE TECHNICAL YOU ARE:


Strong Analytical Skills
Detail oriented: High standard of data quality and integrity
Resourceful: You don’t have all the answers, but you know how to get them
Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking abilities
Adaptable to a fast paced environment and able to pivot quickly to align with changing priorities


CULTURE FIT:


No Ego: No task is too big or small. You are never afraid to ask questions when you are trying to learn and understand things. You have no problem rolling up your sleeves and helping to execute when the team needs help. This humility extends to all aspects of your work and interaction with teammates
Player Coach: You mentor and teach as you execute. You model the behaviour you expect from your team. You don’t just tell others what to do, you know and show how to do it at a high standard
Growth mindset: You have a desire to always continue to grow and learn. This means a willingness to get outside your comfort zone and try new things because you view these as opportunities to gain skills and knowledge
Helping Hand: You always offer to help without having to be asked. You go the extra mile to help out regardless of your team and function
Get S##T Done: Your bias is towards action. This means pitching in and rallying to get things across the finish line. Rather than putting off work ask yourself what you can do today to move the needle on a project or goal
Digs Deep: You aren't afraid to ask questions because you want to understand every issue so that you can properly solve the root cause of the problem instead of just completing the task you are given


JOB PERKS:


Competitive salary: We know life is expensive
Flexible hours: Enjoy a couple more hours of sleep in the morning, if you want
Benefits: Health is wealth! A benefits package with no employee contribution required
Perks: RRSP matching program, individual training allowance, access to financial literacy training and resources
Casual dress code: If it’s good enough for you, it’s good enough for us
Fun team socials


Ratehub welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for experienced and passionate Data Analysts to join one of our agile analytics teams. Our ideal candidate is adept at modeling complex data, uncovering patterns, and delivering data-driven insights to help grow our business effectively and efficiently.




In this role you’ll be a strategic partner, working closely with senior department leaders to define and execute data analytics strategies.




In this role you’ll




Be part of the Analytics chapter, spending your day-to-day as the data expert in either our finance, compliance, insurance & actuarial (FCIA) team, or analytics enablement team
Build and maintain the data analytics infrastructure for accurate and timely reporting and sophisticated analysis
Set measurable and strategic goals, and build new measurement and optimization capabilities
Initiate analyses and deliver business insights that lead directly to process and product improvements
Partner with other data analysts, as well as team members from R&D, Biz Ops, Insurance Product, Actuarial, and Finance to push through cross-functional data projects




What you’ll need




3+ years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably within a fast-growing consumer company
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Proficiency in SQL is essential, knowledge of Python or R, a plus
Proficiency in data visualization is essential, knowledge of Looker, a plus
Hands-on experience with modern data analytics stack (e.g. Snowflake, dbt, Looker, Git),strongly preferred
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with others
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture




*Please note that we are unable to sponsor applicants for work visas




Lemonade's US base salary range for this full-time position is $90,000- $120,000 equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Speak to your recruiter to hear more about the specific salary range for your preferred location.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Functional Analyst

Duration: 6 Month(s), Contract to Hire

Location: Cincinnati, OH

Information

Top 3 Skills:

R (data cleaning, performing calculations on large datasets, performing exploratory data analysis). You will also use Python on occasion.

PowerBI (especially with DAX). Almost all of the data reporting is done in Power BI. Working with Power Query, Dataflows, Row Level Security (RLS) and writing measures with DAX will be a big part of your job.

A great eye for visualization and a focus on the user experience. Our team attaches a lot of importance to making our reports nice looking and user friendly.

Remote candidates will be considered.




Job Description

- Assist with the maintenance of daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly business reporting functions.

- Gather Retail Operations data from multiple databases, platforms, stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors to complete analyze.

- Transform large data sets through data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.

- Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations in large data sets.

- Implement row level security in the Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to enable secured viewing of the reports for designated job levels and locations.

- Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the data needs to execute department and enterprise-wide strategic objectives and initiatives.

- Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and the team.

- Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

• Standardize and solidify data processes and quality

• Assist in developing business reporting

• Increase data availability, standardization and automation processes

• Problem solve and investigate issues

• Participate in all phases of system testing Work successfully in an Agile Project across multiple feature and component teams

• Complete estimates and work plans in Program Increments (PI) Meetings as appropriate for design, development, implementation and rollout tasks

Title: Analista de Datos Jr
Description:
¿Eres un apasionado de los datos y quieres iniciar tu carrera en el sector financiero?

Buscamos un Analista de Datos Junior que desee contribuir a la transformación de la empresa mediante la interpretación y análisis de datos.




Analista de Datos Jr (calidad y gestión).




😊 En este puesto podrás:

Evaluar la calidad de grandes conjuntos de datos mediante la identificación y análisis de problemas como duplicados, inconsistencias, datos incompletos, etc.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con equipos de tecnología, analistas de datos y equipos de negocio para mejorar continuamente la calidad de los datos.
Obtener y limpiar datos utilizados por los distintos dominios existentes en la organización para optimizar su uso; para ello, se tendrá que modelar datos, interpretar los datos y presentar los hallazgos.
Proponer y liderar iniciativas para mejorar los procesos de gestión de datos y optimizar la eficiencia operativa.




🔎 El perfil ideal cuenta con:

Licenciatura en Actuaría, Economía, matemáticas aplicadas, Ingeniería, Sistemas o afín.
SQL (intermedio).
Power BI (deseable).
SAS (deseable).
Python (deseable).
Experiencia en gestión de datos, sistemas integración de datos, calidad de datos y gobierno de datos (1-4 años).
Capacidad para analizar grandes volúmenes de datos (intermedio).




💰 Tus beneficios por ser parte de Profuturo:

Contratación directa.
Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores.
Seguro Dental, Seguro de Vida
Totalpass
Prestaciones superiores a la ley (fondo de ahorro, prima vacacional, 20 días de aguinaldo).
+5,000 materiales de capacitación.
Rutas de formación para tu desarrollo
Oportunidad de participar en voluntariados.
Torneos internos, actividades deportivas y celebraciones corporativas.
Beneficios y descuentos preferenciales.




📍 Tu nueva ubicación laboral:

Boulevard Adolfo López Mateos #2009, Col. Los Alpes, Del. Álvaro Obregón, CDMX.







🎉 Profuturo es una empresa comprometida con igualdad de oportunidades. Todas las personas recibirán consideración para el empleo sin distinción de raza, color, religión, sexo, discapacidad, edad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, origen nacional, condición de veterano o información genética. De igual manera, es política de Profuturo proporcionar ajustes razonables a las personas con discapacidad o con alguna necesidad específica, para garantizar el acceso y uso de los servicios, programas y actividades de trabajo.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Trainee




About the Program:

People Tech Technology is pleased to offer a comprehensive Data Training Program designed for individuals looking to start a career in data science and analytics. This program aims to equip participants with the essential skills and knowledge required to become proficient data professionals.

Key Responsibilities:

Training Participation: Attend and actively engage in all training sessions, workshops, and assignments.
Learning and Development: Utilize training materials, complete exercises, and participate in discussions to deepen understanding of data science and analytics concepts.
Project Work: Apply learned skills by working on real-world projects and assignments with guidance from experienced mentors.
Data Analysis: Conduct data cleaning, analysis, and visualization using various tools and techniques.
Collaboration: Work collaboratively with peers and mentors to foster a productive learning environment.
Feedback and Improvement: Provide and receive constructive feedback to and from peers and mentors to continually improve skills and program experience.

What You Will Learn:

Data Fundamentals: Understanding data types, data collection, and data cleaning techniques.
Statistics and Probability: Basic concepts of statistics and probability used in data analysis.
Programming for Data Science: Using programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.
Data Visualization: Creating visualizations using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Tableau.
Machine Learning: Introduction to machine learning concepts, algorithms, and model evaluation.
Big Data Technologies: Understanding big data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark.
SQL and Databases: Writing SQL queries and understanding database management.
Data Storytelling: Communicating insights effectively through data storytelling and presentation.

Qualifications:

Education: Masters in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field (or currently pursuing one).
Basic Programming Knowledge: Familiarity with basic programming concepts, preferably in any programming language.
Passion for Data: Demonstrated interest in data science and analytics.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Skills (Not Mandatory):

Prior Experience with Data: Any prior experience with data analysis or related fields is a plus.
Knowledge of Statistics: Basic understanding of statistical concepts and methods.

Benefits:

Hands-on Training: Gain practical experience through real-world projects.
Mentorship: Receive guidance and support from experienced data professionals.
Career Opportunities: Potential for full-time employment opportunities upon successful completion of the program.
Networking: Connect with industry professionals and like-minded peers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst, you will be important in driving data-driven decision-making within ERAS in the ERAS Data Services team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analyzing, and interpreting data to uncover valuable insights and support strategic initiatives. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable recommendations will be instrumental in helping us to optimize our operations in providing services to the fellowship and residency recruitment space. Must work East Coast business hours.

Essential Duties

Data Collection and Cleaning


Collect data from various sources (databases, APIs, files)
Clean and prepare data for analysis (removing duplicates, handling missing values, formatting data)


Data Analysis


Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Use data mining and machine learning algorithms to uncover hidden insights
Apply statistical techniques (e.g., descriptive statistics, hypothesis testing, regression analysis)


Data Visualization


Create visualizations (charts, graphs, dashboards) to communicate data findings effectively
Select appropriate visualization techniques based on the data and audience


Reporting


Develop and deliver regular reports and presentations to stakeholders
Summarize key findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner


Problem Solving


Identify and solve data-related problems using analytical and technical skills
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address data challenges


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
3-5 years of experience in data analysis
Strong proficiency in SQL and data manipulation tools
Knowledge of statistical software (e.g., R, Python) is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is beneficial
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


35 hours

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
QuaverEd is a rapidly growing education technology company located on Music Row in Nashville, Tennessee. We specialize in online educational software for Music, Heath and PE, Pre-K, and SEL. 




We are seeking a highly motivated Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a passion for working with data, and the ability to derive actionable insights that drive decision-making. 

 

Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field preferred.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or Python.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to handle large datasets.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data findings in a clear, understandable way.
Enthusiasm for learning and adapting in a fast-paced environment.




Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure data quality and accuracy.
Conduct data analysis using statistical techniques and interpret trends to support business decisions.
Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present insights in a clear, concise manner.
Assist in identifying patterns, correlations, and anomalies within large datasets.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and support their initiatives with relevant insights.
Maintain documentation of data processes, methodologies, and findings.
Participate in special projects as needed.




The person must be located in the Nashville, TN area.




If you do not meet all of our requirements but feel confident in your abilities and/or experience, please apply anyway.




QuaverEd, Inc. offers an excellent benefits package including, 80 hours of vacation per year, 12 paid holidays, 60 hours of sick leave, subsidized health care up to $7,200 per year, subsidized life insurance, a 401(k) program with no participation fees, and a collegial, supporting atmosphere.

QuaverEd, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, or genetic information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Compensation: To $85K.

Job Overview – Data Analyst – 33284

This opportunity is in-office and in Charlotte, NC. Our client does not offer relocation at this time.

In this role, you will be responsible for the build, support, and maintenance of the Tableau data reporting environment. This position works with end-users to ensure accuracy of data collected and reported. Develops, interprets, and implements complex financial and accounting concepts, or techniques for financial planning and control.

Requirements

2-4 years experience in a Data Analyst role
Experience maintaining dashboards and reporting, date source collection and aggregation, testing for data and software continuity, interpret data and investigate trends
Tableau & SQL required
Python, R, Snowflake preferred
Team player, "Get it Done" work mentality
Attention to Detail
Bachelor's Degree

Additional Job Details

Workplace Policy:

Seniority Level: Associate

Linked In Poster:

About Our Process

We will notify you if you are selected as a candidate for this role. If not, but you fit our specializations, we'll consider you for future openings, and encourage you to apply for other Sherpa roles you're qualified for/interested in.
Non-Local Candidates: Please note that you are competing with local candidates who don’t require relocation expenses and can start quickly, so let us know if you have plans to move to the area soon.
Candidates for all Sherpa opportunities must be authorized to work in the United States.
Sherpa is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Create complex queries to extract, analyze, and manipulate data from diverse sources, ensuring high-quality data is available for analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs, contributing to the delivery of comprehensive analytics solutions.

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
Excel, MySQL and SQL
Solid experience in writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a detail-oriented approach to data analysis.
Good communication skills, capable of explaining data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: 80462 - Data Analyst

Job Location: Auburn Hills Michigan 48326

Onsite Requirements:

Utilize Python to automate workflows and build internal tools that streamline analytics and reporting.
Set up automated and scalable backend structure to support reporting and dashboarding needs.

Job Description:

The Data Analyst will perform complex analyses and generate insights to help make and inform important decisions across our organization.
This individual will collaborate with internal teams to identify new metrics, build out reporting, and perform data analyses that leverage internal & external data to drive decision making.

DATA ANALYTICS:

Consults with business leaders to drive improved business performance through statistical analysis and operational research techniques.
Provides prescriptive and predictive analytics expertise to support business stakeholders in understanding opportunity areas.
Provides advanced support as required for compliance with regulations, maintaining an awareness of evolving regulatory guidelines and industry practices.
Develops presentations, artifacts, and documents to communicate analytical results and output.
Collaborates within product teams to deliver/communicate output of advanced analysis to support business priorities.
Research, identify, and integrate new data sources to enhance analyses and support strategic initiatives.

DATA ENGINEERING:

Utilize Python to automate workflows and build internal tools that streamline analytics and reporting.
Set up automated and scalable backend structure to support reporting and dashboarding needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Seeking Data/Support Analysts that can face interesting challenges in a fast-paced environment and aren't afraid to get their hands dirty working with large, disparate data sets, developing complex reporting solutions, and streamlining processes through automation. As a member of the team, you will work closely with other Business and Data Analysts to gain fluency in capital market concepts and become familiar with financial services operations. Our ideal candidates are intellectually curious, self-motivated, and ready to contribute wherever the need arises.

Responsibilities

Research data issues involving large volumes of data stored in various systems
Troubleshoot problems loading data from automated data feeds
Identify repetitive problems and develop permanent solutions
Develop a working understanding of financial concepts related to client data and reporting
Collaborate with business stakeholders and 3rd parties to develop technical solutions that support business processes
Develop client-facing reports based on client requests using proprietary reporting tools
Use SQL to make deeper dives into complex issues to trace problems back to root cause
Work collaboratively in a rapidly growing team
Actively participate in ongoing development and maintenance of our Knowledge Base repository
Some travel to local client offices may be required


Qualifications

Enjoys working with numbers and data in various formats
Pays attention to detail and takes ownership and pride in delivering quality work outputs
Adapts quickly in fast-paced environments, possessing excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Comfortable communicating effectively (written and verbal) as well as working with a team
Takes initiative and ownership of job responsibilities and performs duties accurately and timely
Self-motivated, self-starter, and challenge-seeker
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, or related analytical field with 0-2 years of relevant work experience
US Citizen or Permanent Resident eligible to work in the US without sponsorship


Desired Skills

Fluency with Microsoft Office software, especially Excel
Working knowledge of basic programming concepts desired
Prior Experience with SQL query language in either SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL preferred
Prior Experience with Capital Markets or Finance industry experience preferred


Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.




Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more.

HTML:
Seeking Data/Support Analysts that can face interesting challenges in a fast-paced environment and aren't afraid to get their hands dirty working with large, disparate data sets, developing complex reporting solutions, and streamlining processes through automation. As a member of the team, you will work closely with other Business and Data Analysts to gain fluency in capital market concepts and become familiar with financial services operations. Our ideal candidates are intellectually curious, self-motivated, and ready to contribute wherever the need arises.

Responsibilities

  • Research data issues involving large volumes of data stored in various systems
  • Troubleshoot problems loading data from automated data feeds
  • Identify repetitive problems and develop permanent solutions
  • Develop a working understanding of financial concepts related to client data and reporting
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and 3rd parties to develop technical solutions that support business processes
  • Develop client-facing reports based on client requests using proprietary reporting tools
  • Use SQL to make deeper dives into complex issues to trace problems back to root cause
  • Work collaboratively in a rapidly growing team
  • Actively participate in ongoing development and maintenance of our Knowledge Base repository
  • Some travel to local client offices may be required


Qualifications

  • Enjoys working with numbers and data in various formats
  • Pays attention to detail and takes ownership and pride in delivering quality work outputs
  • Adapts quickly in fast-paced environments, possessing excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Comfortable communicating effectively (written and verbal) as well as working with a team
  • Takes initiative and ownership of job responsibilities and performs duties accurately and timely
  • Self-motivated, self-starter, and challenge-seeker
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, or related analytical field with 0-2 years of relevant work experience
  • US Citizen or Permanent Resident eligible to work in the US without sponsorship


Desired Skills

  • Fluency with Microsoft Office software, especially Excel
  • Working knowledge of basic programming concepts desired
  • Prior Experience with SQL query language in either SQL Server, Oracle, or MySQL preferred
  • Prior Experience with Capital Markets or Finance industry experience preferred

Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Genesis10 is seeking a Data Analyst for a 6-month remote contract position with a leading client. The target hourly W2 pay rate is between $50-60/HR W2 based on experience. Candidates applying must be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder and able to work on a W2 basis directly with Genesis10.

Job Description:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for data mapping, required to deliver vital information to the consumer population for multiple data assets.

Job Duties:


Owns the attribution mapping details for data elements from the source systems to the target analytics data assets and Wealth-specific data solutions including, but not limited to star marts, extracts, hierarchies, and point-to-point solutions to support Wealth domain assets.
Independently translates business requirements to detailed mapping documents, develops and unit tests datasets building maintainable code to accelerate delivery through reusability, and performs peer code reviews.
Embraces mentorship and provides training for less experienced business and data analysts.
Provides continuous improvement ideas to reduce expenses, improve efficiency, and elevate quality.
Assesses the technical viability of new and emerging data solutions providing design guidance, technical recommendations, performance optimization, and development insights.
Contributes to technical documentation, specifications, and project artifacts for developing data solutions.
Adheres to and identifies standards and best practices to be extended beyond the Foundational Analytics and Wealth Squad.
Give input into Data Models and Entity Relationship Diagrams and use those documents to build efficient SQL.
Create and enhance context diagrams for data solutions to maintain auditability.
Provide all the business rules, transformation logic, derived column expressions, SQL, etc. to build mapping documents.
Participate and give feedback in Mapping Review Sessions and Data Architecture Review Sessions.


Requirements:


Data mapping and modeling experience
SQL, SAS and Python experience
Knowledge of portfolio planning, project prioritization, and remediation planning activities.
Strong knowledge of Risk Management practices associated with Financial Institution or financial data.
Education: Master's Degree and 4+ years data analytics experience, Bachelor's Degree and 7+ years data analytics experience, or equivalent military/work experience.
Possess strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in Google Cloud Platform, notable Big Query.
Experience programming in SQL, SAS and Python.
Experience in data mapping and modeling.


Preferred Experience:


Experience with Agile Methodologies, Jira, Confluence, Miro, and Asana.
Experience working with Wealth Systems including Envestnet, Pershing, GlobalPlus, and Omnipay Nextgen or similar products is highly preferred.
Extensive experience analyzing and interpreting business data leveraging various techniques including automation for data quality validations.
Experience in AbInitio or AbInitio Spectograph.
Experience working with APIs and a solution orchestration layer is a plus.


If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!

Genesis10 Contract & Perm Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals.

For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client.

Benefits of Working with Genesis10:


Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years.
The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years.
Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.)
Behavioral Health Platform
Medical, Dental, Vision
Health Savings Account
Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident)
Voluntary Term Life Insurance
401K
Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities)
Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF)
Remote opportunities available


For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website.

Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Analyst, Consumer Insights, NBC News
Description:
Company Description

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

Job Description

The NBC News Consumer Insights team looks to advance the understanding of the attitudes and motivations of our audiences. The Consumer Insights team uses quantitative research (surveys) and qualitative methods (focus groups, online communities, content analysis) to understand audience connection points with NBC News brands like TODAY, Nightly News, Meet the Press, Dateline and NBC News NOW. Our research informs editorial, marketing, product and ad sales efforts across linear and digital platforms.

Responsibilities


Work with the Director of Consumer Insights to support the NBC News editorial and marketing teams with program testing, brand trackers, promo testing and brand studies.
Assist with custom primary research projects from start to finish, including research design, writing surveys, analyzing results and writing reports and presentations.
Help program and proof surveys using various online platforms.
Assist with analysing research data to develop strategic insights and in preparing reports for internal clients.
Help review and synthesize existing secondary research studies on the news landscape to help internal clients stay on top of consumer trends.
Identify and pull video clips as needed for research projects.
Assist team with coordinating and planning research presentations.


Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. Salary range: $62,000-$80,000.

Qualifications


A BA/BS preferably in communications, psychology, sociology or another social science or relevant work experience
1+ years of experience in an analyst position
Knowledge of quantitative research methods (survey design, analysis and statistics)
Solid deductive thinker with the ability to synthesize key insights from multiple sources
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficient with Excel and PowerPoint


Desired Competencies


Demonstrated enthusiasm for consumer insights research
Interest in both quantitative and qualitative research
Highly organized and able to prioritize and execute on multiple projects
Ability to work as part of a team and under tight deadlines
Proactive problem solver


Additional Information

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision.

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst- Healthcare




Aarista Technology is proprietary and vertically integrated technology EMR solutions enable providers to enhance medication adherence through improved access, owned physician network, information sharing, data analytics, and customizable insights.




We are looking for an experience SQL Data Analyst specializing in writing SQL and understanding healthcare data. This person will play a key role on the core product and development team that is working on building our next generation suite of EMR products. As a member of our core product and development team, this person will contribute significantly to the business and clinical requirements designing and implementing various product features using agile methodologies.




MUST HAVE recent experience with healthcare datasets (EHR)




Your Role

Full understanding of Aarista Datasets.
Perform impact analysis of existing datasets and new datasets
Collaborate with various teams and other stakeholders build queries to meet requirements.
Test and validate.
Brainstorm with your team to conceptualize and build new features.

You

You are the expert with writing queries using Azure SQL
You have a good knowledge and understanding of relational data modelling methodologies
You are a motivated, enthusiastic person looking for a rewarding position with a great innovative startup and want to achieve big things with us.
You thrive in a team environment but can also work independently.
You are passionate about using your knowledge and skills to solve real healthcare problems and are motivated by understanding the value that your work adds.
A self-starter that can manage their own workload and an ever-growing task list.
A team player and leader.
Problem solving of potential roadblocks which could potentially impact patient care, strategic, and technical goals of the business.
Consistently meeting timelines and deliverables.




Skills: MUST HAVE recent experience with healthcare datasets and expert in writing SQL in Azure SQL and/or SQL Server environments




Job Types: Full-time currently hybrid but could change to full-time in office based on companies’ decision.




Pay: Competitive pay and benefits and valuable startup stock options

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a well-established manufacturing company that is looking for a Data Analyst who will provide deep insights into their data for all aspects of the business.




In this role, you will work with Sales, Operations, Finance, and Manufacturing to gather requirements for data and reporting needs. You will then leverage SQL to extract data from the ERP system to build custom dashboards using Power BI for analytics.




This role allows you to have a full view of the overall business and be able to inform the strategic plan moving forward.




This role has onsite requirements.




Responsibilities

Ability to work with stakeholders to understand the business needs for data and analytics
Extract data from the ERP using SQL and then build dashboards and reports that deliver on the business needs
Ensure data accuracy and quality for the ERP
Assist with other IT projects as needed




Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree
Relational Database Experience, preferably MSSQL
Experience creating meaningful dashboards using one of the following; Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or Qlik
Excellent analytical and communication skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Darwill is a third-generation, family-owned performance-based marketing powerhouse based in the western suburbs of Chicago, IL. Since 1951, we’ve been impressing clients of all sizes and industries with our proven direct marketing solutions.




What’s our secret sauce? We're not just a one-solution marketing company; we're a full-service, dedicated partner! From omnichannel strategies to eye-opening data insights, response-inducing creative, seamless production, and sophisticated reporting tools – we've got it all!




Our Mission: To empower national and local businesses through performance-based marketing by executing complex location-based data-driven campaigns, leading to increased sales, sustainability, and an improved return on investment.




At Darwill, we don't just build marketing campaigns; we create a culture of success and positivity! We value respect, collaboration, empowerment, and giving back to the community. We're a team of spirited individuals working together to redefine client success.




Apply now, and let's embark on a thrilling adventure together! Your next chapter begins at Darwill.







Responsibilities:




Working within the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform:
Utilize SQL, Python and PySpark to extract, transform, and analyze consumer data from various sources
Clean and prepare data for analysis, ensuring data integrity and consistency
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights from consumer behavior
Develop prospect targeting lists based on data-driven segmentation and profiling
Collaborate with account managers and account executives to integrate data-driven insights into marketing strategies for clients
Collaborate with data engineers to identify available source data and ELT process updates necessary to address new client requests
Prepare and present data-driven reports to stakeholders, effectively communicating findings and recommendations
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis techniques and tools




Qualifications:




Databricks Data Analyst Associate certification
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field
3+ years of experience and high proficiency in data analysis or business intelligence using SQL and Python for data manipulation and analysis
Experience developing dashboards with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written communication and presentation skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team




Highly desirable, but not required to apply:




Experience with machine learning and data mining techniques
Experience with CRM systems and marketing automation platforms
Experience in developing predictive models and forecasting
Experience with market segmentation techniques




Work Environment/Physical Demands:




May be required to work extended/evening hours as needed
This job offers hybrid work, with approximately 2 days per week in-office at our Oakbrook Terrace headquarters location and the remainder remote from the Chicago area

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst




Location: Beaverton, OR (97005) / Remote




Note: Candidates must reside in one of the following states: AZ, DC, FL, IL, KS, MO, NY, NC, OH, OR, TN, MD, NJ, SC, VA, WA, AL, CO, CT, DE, GA, ID, IN, KY, LA, MA, MI, MN, NV, OK, PA, TX, UT, WI, AR, IA, ME, MS, MT, NE, NH, NM, ND, RI, SD, VT, WV, WY




Employment Type: 4+ Month W2 Contract (no C2C or sponsorship available)




Job Description:




Join an enterprise legal services organization as a Data Analyst. Ideal candidates will have a background in T-SQL data analysis, strong SQL skills, and the ability to work independently. We are seeking candidates with the following qualifications:




Job Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain ETL processes
Create and maintain database stored procedures, functions, views, and triggers
Write custom and ad-hoc SQL queries and perform updates




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
2+ years of hands-on experience with MS SQL Server (2008 R2 or newer) as a developer or DBA

Experience with SSIS preferred

Title: Data Insights and Analytics Associate
Description:
Job Description

General Overview:

This entry-level position focuses on the delivery of custom reports in support of the Primary Market Research team. In collaboration with other members of our client services team, you will analyze primary market research data using analytics technologies to create custom visual reports that deliver concise insights for stakeholders at top life science companies.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:


Create custom insights reports implementing industry best practices for data visualization in PowerPoint, using InCrowd’s technology and tools
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure report deliverables clearly represent research findings and address client needs within agreed timelines
Work within Client Service Team Pod to better understand specific client products, research preferences, and the market forces affecting their business
Analyze and synthesize research across quantitative and qualitative methodologies into clear and compelling client-ready reports
Hand-off topline analysis to external vendors so that they may provide support to the reports you are owning
Perform quality management checks on client deliverable to ensure data quality is upheld across all projects


Qualifications:

Educational / Technical


Bachelor's degree: background or focus on life sciences, statistics or data analytics a plus
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office tools including Excel and PowerPoint
Background in use of data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.) is a plus
Background in use of data analytics tools (DisplayR, Qlikview, SAS, Python etc.) is a plus


Required Skills:


Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
Impeccable attention to detail
Proactive problem-solving abilities
Strong analytical mindset
Effective oral and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

Our financial services client is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team and support their cloud migration initiative.




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct advanced data analysis, including data mining and trend analysis, to generate actionable insights.
Develop interactive dashboards and visualizations using Power BI, Tableau, MS PowerPoint, and MS Excel.
Create user-friendly documentation, reports, and pages in collaboration tools such as SharePoint.
Utilize design-thinking principles to create data solutions that align with business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy through validation, cleaning, and enrichment processes.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

4-5 years of experience in data analysis, within the financial services industry.
Strong data visualization skills and proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, or Tableau.
Familiarity with Confluence, SharePoint, and Visio or Draw.IO.
Exposure to technology modernization projects.

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

MITRE is seeking an experienced Market Data professional to continue the growth of our Market Intelligence capability in support of a diverse set of internal and external sponsors. The Market Data Analyst role involves consolidating multiple sources of data into a cleansed, enriched, and actionable data set that can be connected and modified to address key business questions. This role requires an individual that is comfortable with gathering and synthesizing the data, as well as applying strategic thinking to the curation, enrichment and augmentation of the data to enhance future analysis.

Target projects include cleansing and enriching large data sets following Federal contracted obligations, architecting data constructs and data dashboards, market analysis & modeling (overall market and sub-markets), creating connection between multiple data sets for end user analysis. The work also includes engaging with internal clients to scope and prioritize tasks, collecting and working with large datasets to perform data-driven analyses, and performing additional data research as necessary. This position supports other department capabilities in business analyses, strategy, and market intelligence as needed.

This position will interact with all levels of the company, including senior level managers, technical SMEs, and analysts. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience performing market analysis on government funding/budget, industry trends, and market participants, an entrepreneurial approach to generating and creating value and impact, and an appreciation for a nonprofit/public interest environment.

Roles & Responsibilities:


Work as part of a dynamic team environment where tasks are rarely routine and often require novel approaches.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, with limited structure and supervision.
Assist in identifying sources of information and gathering a wide range of quantitative and qualitative data to support decisions that have implications for MITRE and its government sponsors
Apply analysis skills, including exploratory data analysis to organize, analyze, and synthesize data into consumable deliverables
Assist in developing data visualization dashboards and deliverables that improve the presentation of complex data sets
Translate unstructured data and nontraditional sources of information into dashboards for business insights
Create data baselines for various market segments and businesses
Obtain, merge, reshape, clean, and evaluate the quality of datasets associated with various markets; work with developers to, where applicable, automate data pulls, manipulation, and other activities to enable efficient operations
Work with cross-functional data architecture, data science and support roles to enhance data automation and visualizations
Assist in analysis, transition, and improvement at multiple levels of data architecture design and execution


Basic Qualifications:


Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in: Business, Data Science, Operations, Data Analytics, or related field and a minimum of 2 years of related experience in domains such as data analytics, market analytics, market modeling, data architecture; or an advanced degree with relevant experience who can immediately contribute at this job step; or equivalent combination of related education and work experience.
Experience with data analysis, data architecture, and visualization tools, Python, SQL, Tableau and experience with cloud data warehouses
Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated skills and experience in presenting analytical results both verbally and in writing
This position requires a minimum of 50% hybrid on-site


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s in Business Administration or another related field
Understanding of U.S. government funding data sources and experience with/knowledge of the government contracting market
Experience in government contractor consulting and/or in an environment monitoring federal policy and/or appropriations
Knowledge of the federal R&D environment and the role and value of federally-funded research and development centers


This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s):

None

This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s):

None

Work Location Type:

Hybrid

MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. MITRE recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of age; ancestry; color; family medical or genetic information; gender identity and expression; marital, military, or veteran status; national and ethnic origin; physical or mental disability; political affiliation; pregnancy; race; religion; sex; sexual orientation; and any other protected characteristics. For further information please visit the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission website EEO is the Law Poster and Pay Transparency.

MITRE intends to maintain a website that is fully accessible to all individuals. If you are unable to search or apply for jobs and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of MITRE’s employment process, please email recruitinghelp@mitre.org.

Title: Strategy & Analytics Data Analyst
Description:
Strategy & Analytics Data Analyst




About Cartesian




Cartesian is seeking great analytical thinkers and problem solvers to join our talented team of strategy consultants. Our strategy consulting team works with clients on engagements that drive value and growth within the communications, media, and technology sectors. Cartesian’s Strategy & Analytics practice has a 20+ year track record helping companies and investors develop and implement market-leading strategies to solve their most important challenges.




We take a data/technology-focused approach to help our clients craft business strategies, evaluate market opportunity, improve performance, and drive revenue growth through competitive differentiation. As a boutique consulting practice, we use our subject matter expertise, data-driven methodologies, and creative problem-solving skills to rapidly drive meaningful, measurable results.

Cartesian is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.




About this Job




Data Analysts in our strategy and analytics practice work on 2-5 person project teams to build and manage complex data processes that provide actionable analytics and reporting to our clients. We are looking for individuals who are excited to use a range of technologies to analyze data, develop and automate analytics and reporting workflows, build predictive models, investigate complex processes, identify/execute process improvement opportunities, and communicate clear recommendations to clients in a fun, fast paced environment.




Responsibilities include:




Contribute to the development, execution, and management of multi-year analytics focused consulting engagements by developing and managing critical ETL, analytics, and reporting processes
Gather and process structured and unstructured data in a wide variety of formats (Excel, text, csv, database etc.) from multiple sources to support the delivery of comprehensive and accurate information to our clients
Build thoughtful quality control process to ensure data integrity from load stages through the end-to-end data integration and dashboard/reporting development processes
Proactively resolve data exceptions through investigative analysis and by collaborating with our technical team to explore and creatively resolve technical challenges or issues
Develop, maintain, and update analytics frameworks, reports and web-based dashboards to meet client needs, including the development of actionable KPIs and summary metrics to be reported
Create thoughtful data visualizations that communicate insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Build and maintain predictive analytics and machine learning models that provide actionable insight to our clients
Provide analysis to support client requests, including providing data summaries, conducting statistical analysis, and synthesizing findings to build a fact base and tell compelling stories




Desired Skills and Experience




A passion for problem solving, with a focus on creative solutions to meeting client needs
Strong organizational and communication skills, with an ability to clearly articulate actions and plans to the internal team and client stakeholders, and to maintain clear documentation of key data processes
Experience developing ETL processes, and visualizing data to generate clear executive-level reports and/or dashboards from underlying data sources
Effective time management, and ability to proactively set priorities/objectives and execute against them
A desire to work both independently and in team settings
Experience working with and managing complicated and/or messy data from numerous sources
Bachelor’s degree preferably in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, business, mathematics, statistics)
0-2 years in a quantitative data operations or analytics role




Optional but preferred is knowledge and/or experience in the following:




Data Analysis conducted in SQL, Python, R, SAS, Alteryx, etc.
Microsoft Office products (especially Excel and PowerPoint)
Data visualization (Tableau, Qlik, R, etc.)




Location: Boston

Show more

  • A passion for problem solving, with a focus on creative solutions to meeting client needs
  • Strong organizational and communication skills, with an ability to clearly articulate actions and plans to the internal team and client stakeholders, and to maintain clear documentation of key data processes
  • Experience developing ETL processes, and visualizing data to generate clear executive-level reports and/or dashboards from underlying data sources
  • Effective time management, and ability to proactively set priorities/objectives and execute against them
  • A desire to work both independently and in team settings
  • Experience working with and managing complicated and/or messy data from numerous sources
  • Bachelor’s degree preferably in a quantitative field (e.g., computer science, business, mathematics, statistics)
  • 0-2 years in a quantitative data operations or analytics role


Optional but preferred is knowledge and/or experience in the following:


  • Data Analysis conducted in SQL, Python, R, SAS, Alteryx, etc.
  • Microsoft Office products (especially Excel and PowerPoint)
  • Data visualization (Tableau, Qlik, R, etc.)


Location: Boston

Title: Data Analyst (remote)
Description:
Software Guidance & Assistance, Inc., (SGA), is searching for a Data Analyst for a remote consulting assignment with one of our premier clients.

As the Data Strategy Analyst, you will interface directly with vendors on ad hoc requests ensuring that our partnerships align with our client and business objectives. Your expertise in managing vendors will be key in driving stakeholder satisfaction and maximizing business value. Solid experience in procurement, vendor management, and third-party data will be highly valuable in supporting stakeholder objectives.

Required Qualifications:

Proven experience in procurement, vendor management, and third-party data

MS Office (Excel, Outlook, Teams).

Expert in Pivot Tables and VLOOKUP.

Excellent written and communication skills.

Ability to work independently.

Preferred Qualifications:

Advanced Excel.

Coding.

SAP Ariba.

SGA is a technology and resource solutions provider driven to stand out. We are a women-owned business. Our mission: to solve big IT problems with a more personal, boutique approach. Each year, we match consultants like you to more than 1,000 engagements. When we say let's work better together, we mean it. You'll join a diverse team built on these core values: customer service, employee development, and quality and integrity in everything we do. Be yourself, love what you do and find your passion at work. Please find us at https://sgainc.com/ .
